channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024050176
item.description:
Report X-2024050176

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO HAZMAT AUDITOR HOLDING AREA FOR A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED PACKAGE DISCOVERED BY CUSTOMER COUNTER CLERK. PACKAGE WAS SUPPOSED TO CONTAIN AUTO PARTS AS DECLARED BY THE SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE HAD 3 PAINT CANS. PACKAGE IN BEING HELD FOR REGULATORY INSPECTION.

item.title: Report E-2024050014
item.description:
Report E-2024050014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: WATERFORD TOWNSHIP
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) pounds of material released from one (1) 100-pound cardboard box due to a rip against the trailer wall during offloading. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the released material and containerized the recovered material into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum along with the spent PPE. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
